    • Constructor Detail

      • Component

        public Component(int left,
                 int top)
        The default constructor for a component.

        Laying out components is simply relative positioning. So for left (x position), specific how many pixels from the left of the application window you want it to be positioned at. The top is the same, but instead from the top (y position).

        Parameters:
        left - how many pixels from the left
        top - how many pixels from the top

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init(Layout layout)
        Called when this component is added to a Layout. You can add sub-components through this method. Use Layout.addComponent(Component)
        Parameters:
        layout -

      • render

        protected void render(com.mrcrayfish.device.core.Laptop laptop,
                      net.minecraft.client.Minecraft mc,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int mouseX,
                      int mouseY,
                      boolean windowActive,
                      float partialTicks)
        The main render loop. This is where you draw your component.
        Parameters:
        laptop - a Laptop instance
        mc - a Minecraft instance
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        windowActive - if the window is active (at front)
        partialTicks - percentage passed in-between two ticks

      • renderOverlay

        protected void renderOverlay(com.mrcrayfish.device.core.Laptop laptop,
                             net.minecraft.client.Minecraft mc,
                             int mouseX,
                             int mouseY,
                             boolean windowActive)
        The overlay render loop. Renders over the top of the main render loop.
        Parameters:
        laptop - a Laptop instance
        mc - a Minecraft instance
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        windowActive - if the window is active (at front)

      • handleMouseClick

        protected void handleMouseClick(int mouseX,
                                int mouseY,
                                int mouseButton)
        Called when you mouse button has been pressed. You have to do your own checking to test if it was within the component's bounds.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        mouseButton - the clicked mouse button

      • handleKeyTyped

        protected void handleKeyTyped(char character,
                              int code)
        Called when a key is typed from your keyboard.
        Parameters:
        character - the typed character
        code - the typed character code

      • handleKeyReleased

        protected void handleKeyReleased(char character,
                                 int code)
        Called when a key is released from your keyboard.
        Parameters:
        character - the released character
        code - the released character code

      • handleMouseDrag

        protected void handleMouseDrag(int mouseX,
                               int mouseY,
                               int mouseButton)
        Called when you drag the mouse with a button pressed down.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
        mouseY - the current y position of the mouse
        mouseButton - the pressed mouse button

      • handleMouseRelease

        protected void handleMouseRelease(int mouseX,
                                  int mouseY,
                                  int mouseButton)
        Called when you release the currently pressed mouse button. You have to do your own checking to test if it was within the component's bounds.
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the x position of the release
        mouseY - the y position of the release
        mouseButton - the button that was released

      • handleMouseScroll

        protected void handleMouseScroll(int mouseX,
                                 int mouseY,
                                 boolean direction)

      • updateComponents

        protected void updateComponents(int x,
                                int y)
        This method should be ignored. Used for the core. Will probably be removed in the future.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether this component is enabled. You should respect this value if you create your own custom components.
        Parameters:
        enabled - if this component should be enabled or not

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Sets whether this component is visible. You should respect this value if you create your own custom components.
        Parameters:
        visible - if this component should be visible or not
